priority.when: First action when researching libraries, frameworks, or technologies
priority.why: Provides authoritative, up-to-date documentation from official sources

priority.when: Context7 doesn't have the needed information or for general web research
priority.why: Accesses latest community discussions, tutorials, and unofficial resources

priority.when: Research is inconclusive or user clarification is needed
priority.why: Ensures we're solving the right problem with the right approach

tool.name: use_mcp_tool
tool.purpose: Access official documentation and code examples for libraries and frameworks
tool.when_to_use: Whenever researching a specific technology, pattern, or library

best_practices.practice: Always resolve library ID before getting docs
Specify topic when requesting docs to get focused information
Verify information is current by checking version/date if available

tool.name: execute_command
tool.purpose: Perform web searches and access online resources not available through Context7
tool.when_to_use: When Context7 doesn't have sufficient information or for community insights

best_practices.practice: Prefer official documentation sites in search (e.g., site:docs.example.com)
Check multiple sources to verify information

example.scenario: Finding recent blog posts about architectural patterns

tool.name: ask_followup_question
tool.purpose: Get clarification from the user when research is insufficient or ambiguous
tool.when_to_use: When research doesn't provide a clear answer or direction

best_practices.practice: Explain why you're asking the question

example.code: ask_followup_question(question="What are the specific performance requirements for this system?", follow_up=[ "High throughput (10k+ requests/second)", "Low latency (sub-100ms response time)", "Cost optimization is the primary concern", "Scalability for future growth is most important" ])
